name: World Labs
title: Academic AI Spin-Off — World Models

classification.classificationRationale: Academic spin-off from Stanford (Fei-Fei Li, Justin Johnson). Research lab focused on 'world models' with Marble product launch. Dual research lab + product development. Low confidence — single thin source.

description: World Labs was founded by Fei-Fei Li (Stanford professor, ImageNet creator) and Justin Johnson as an AI research lab spin-off from academia. The company launched 'Marble,' a generative world model for editable 3D environments, representing the move from pure research toward product. World Labs occupies a similar space to AMI Labs (Yann LeCun) — both are academic-origin research labs pursuing alternatives to the dominant LLM paradigm, focused on spatial understanding and world models.

layers.label: Initial Documentation
layers.summary: Fei-Fei Li + Justin Johnson founded World Labs. Launched Marble — generative world model for editable 3D environments.

taxonomyFeedback: Academic spin-offs pursuing non-LLM AI research (world models) may represent a distinct pattern — researchers leaving Big Tech or academia to build independent research labs with eventual product ambitions.
